DataElement.preferredDefinition: An enumerated list of reasons for a subject to be removed from the treatment or intervention phase of a protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the details of the patient going off protocol treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Off-Treatment; the phase of a protocol during which a patient does not receive treatment.

Concepts.definition: When a patient is not receiving therapy they are considered off treatment.  In clinical trials, a dosing schedule may require a patient to stop medication for a period of time, then resume, such as 28 days on and 7 days off.

Property.preferredDefinition: A statement or an account describing something.

Concepts.definition: A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An enumerated list of reasons for a subject to be taken off the treatment or intervention phase of a protocol.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any medical substance or procedure not generally accepted by orthodox western medicine or an unorthodox application of an otherwise accepted substance or procedure.

Concepts.definition: Any medical substance or procedure not generally accepted by orthodox western medicine or an unorthodox application of an otherwise accepted substance or procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical study status designating the study has been completed normally, according to the protocol. Subject enrollment stopped. No participants are treated or being followed up.

Concepts.definition: A clinical study status designating the study has been completed normally, according to the protocol. Subject enrollment stopped. No participants are treated or being followed up.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.: The cessation of life.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
The cessation of life.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that continues to grow or spread.

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To or at a greater distance in time or space.: A period in a clinical study during which subjects receive therapeutic treatment.: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

Concepts.definition: To or at a greater distance in time or space.
A period in a clinical study during which subjects receive therapeutic treatment.
To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The coexistence of two or more disease processes.

Concepts.definition: The coexistence of two or more disease processes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Toxicity; the degree to which something is poisonous.

Concepts.definition: The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.: A response indicating that an individual has not been treated for cancer.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
A response indicating that an individual has not been treated for cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An event or decision that stands in contrast to the guidelines set out by the protocol.

Concepts.definition: An event or decision that stands in contrast to the guidelines set out by the protocol.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No treatment, per protocol criteria
The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

Concepts.definition: The state or quality of being disqualified by law, rule, or provision.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The branch of biology that studies the cellular aspects of heredity, especially the chromosomes. Includes the study of disease states caused by numerical and structural chromosome abnormalities.: A Resistance Process consists of activities of biologic molecules or complexes involved in processes that maintain immunity to, or counteract, defeat, or withstand the effects of, an antagonistic agent.

Concepts.definition: The branch of biology that studies the cellular aspects of heredity, especially the chromosomes. Includes the study of disease states caused by numerical and structural chromosome abnormalities.

A Resistance Process consists of activities of biologic molecules or complexes involved in processes that maintain immunity to, or counteract, defeat, or withstand the effects of, an antagonistic agent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Declining to take part in activities or procedures that are available to, or requested or expected of, an individual.

Concepts.definition: Declining to take part in activities or procedures that are available to, or requested or expected of, an individual.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The worsening of a disease over time.

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Treatment Complete but Patient Refused Protocl-Specified Follow-up

Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

Concepts.definition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects receive therapeutic treatment.: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: A period in a clinical study during which subjects receive therapeutic treatment.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An investigator who is responsible for all aspects of the conduct of a study.: A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.

Concepts.definition: An investigator who is responsible for all aspects of the conduct of a study.
A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Parted with; no longer held or possessed; incapable of being recovered or regained._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

Concepts.definition: Parted with; no longer held or possessed; incapable of being recovered or regained.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements._The freedom or authority to act according to one's own judgment.

Concepts.definition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.
The freedom or authority to act according to one's own judgment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.: Any examination performed to assess if a female is gravid.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.
Any examination performed to assess if a female is gravid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A time interval during which there is a temporary cessation of something.: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

Concepts.definition: A time interval during which there is a temporary cessation of something.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Failing to satisfy an established set of qualifying measures.: The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

Concepts.definition: Failing to satisfy an established set of qualifying measures.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.: Express the need or desire for; ask for.: To cease active participation in; remove from active use.: Exerting influence or producing an effect; taking part in an activity.: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Express the need or desire for; ask for.
To cease active participation in; remove from active use.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Failure of a patient to follow medical advice, take medication as directed, or adhere to a prescribed course of treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.: An increase in extent or intensity; to become more serious.

At some point in a given period of time.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or occurring at an advanced period of time or after a usual or expected time.: A problem that occurs when treatment affects healthy tissues or organs. Some common side effects of cancer treatment are fatigue, pain, nausea, vomiting, decreased blood cell counts, hair loss, and mouth sores.: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Concepts.definition: Being or occurring at an advanced period of time or after a usual or expected time.

The term was used in various ways in the past, to describe unintended effects of medical intervention, usually negative (unfavourable), but also positive (favourable) ones. It is recommended that this term no longer be used and particularly should not be regarded as synonymous with adverse event or adverse reaction.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
